definition: Yan Hui (521-481 BC), disciple of Confucius, also known as Yan Yuan 顏淵|颜渊[Yan2 Yuan1]
surname Yan
Japanese variant of 顏|颜[yan2]
color/face/countenance
to curve/to return/to revolve
to circle/to go back/to turn around/to answer/to return/to revolve/Hui ethnic group (Chinese Muslims)/time/classifier for acts of a play/section or chapter (of a classic book)
variant of 迴|回[hui2]

sentences.english: What Confucius said couldn't dissuade Yanhui yet. He went on saying, "I will be upright inside and deferential outside."
sentences.chinese: 颜回要去卫国的决心并没有因为老师这一席话而打消。

sentences.english: In the past many years, Yan Hui studied very hard and had never shown laches.
sentences.chinese: 这些年来，颜回努力用功，从来没有懈怠之心。

sentences.english: Confucius was both Yan Hui's friend and master.
sentences.chinese: 孔子与颜回在修行的路上是亦师亦友。

sentences.english: The lenient stool tilts, and Yan Hui pours water in.
sentences.chinese: 宥坐倾斜的样子，颜回倒水。

sentences.english: Once the Confucius praised his disciple Yan Hui for "no vent".
sentences.chinese: 孔子曾赞扬弟子颜回“不迁怒”。

sentences.english: Yan Hui had been Confucius' student for a long time.
sentences.chinese: 颜回跟随孔子学习已经有许多年了。

sentences.english: Carrying luggage Yanhui visited Confucius to say farewell.
sentences.chinese: 颜回提着简单的行李到孔子那儿去辞行。

definition: Yan Yuan (521-481 BC), disciple of Confucius 孔夫子[Kong3 fu1 zi3], also known as 顏回|颜回[Yan2 Hui2]
Confucius (551-479 BC), Chinese thinker and social philosopher, also known as 孔夫子[Kong3 fu1 zi3]
Zi Gong or Duanmu Ci 端木賜|端木赐[Duan1 mu4 Ci4] (520 BC-), disciple of Confucius
Zi Lu (542-480 BC), disciple of Confucius 孔夫子[Kong3 fu1 zi3], also known as Ji Lu 季路[Ji4 Lu4]
Zengzi (505-435 BC), student of Confucius, presumed editor or author of Confucian classic the Great Learning 大學|大学[Da4 xue2]
Confucius
Mencius (c. 372-c. 289 BC), Confucian philosopher second only to Confucius/book of the same name, one of the classics of Confucianism
Zai Yu (522-458 BC), disciple of Confucius
Confucius' school (i.e. his direct disciples)
the Sage Confucius
another name for Laozi 老子[Lao3 zi3]
Master/(old form of address for teachers, scholars)/pedant
Xun Zi or Hsun Tzu (c. 310-237 BC), Confucian philosopher and author of On learning 勸學|劝学
Confucius (551-479 BC), Chinese thinker and social philosopher, also known as 孔子[Kong3 zi3]
Duanmu Ci (520 BC-446 BC), disciple of Confucius, also known as Zi Gong 子貢|子贡[Zi3 Gong4]
great person of the past/venerable forebear/the great and the good
